page.title: 18Local Landmarks-Dorking NE
page.content: Mr.Sheppard is a grey-haired, talkative,{elderly local historian.}He believes that life has progressed too quickly in too short a time. He does not want to see the{"green belt"}being destroyed. He is Vice-President of the local Residents Association in order to put his ideas into practice. He thinks that a{father no longer has a {respected position in the family}and that this is a pity. Mrs. Osgood runs the{Pixham Post {Office}with her husband. The shop opens at 6a.m.(for newspapers) and shuts at 6.30 p.m.It opens daily, but Wednesdays and Sundays are half days. The shop is a Sub Post Office.It can provide most{daily needs for the {pensioners and young couples}who live nearby.Together with the church it plays a big part in a little community.
